chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
x: X
m: list X

Goal:
Forall (eq x) m -> (exists m', m = x :: x :: m') \/ m = nil \/ m = x :: nil

Premises:
Inductive eq (A : Type) (x : A) : A -> Prop := eq_refl : x = x Arguments eq {A}%type_scope Arguments eq_refl {A}%type_scope {x}, [A] _
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
incl_cons_rinv : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (l m : list X), incl m (x :: l) -> exists m1 m2 : list X, m ~p m1 ++ m2 /\ Forall (eq x) m1 /\ incl m2 l
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
list_cons_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x y : X), x :: r1 = l2 ++ y :: r2 -> (l2 = nil /\ x = y /\ r1 = r2) + {m : list X | l2 = x :: m /\ r1 = m ++ y :: r2}
Forall2_nil_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (m : list X), Forall2 R m nil -> m = nil
Forall2_nil_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (m : list Y), Forall2 R nil m -> m = nil
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m < -> n = m
Nat.sub_0_le : forall n m : nat, n - m = 0 < -> n <= m
incl_app_rinv : forall (X : Type) (l m p : list X), incl m (l ++ p) -> exists m1 m2 : list X, m ~p m1 ++ m2 /\ incl m1 l /\ incl m2 p
Nat.max_lub_lt_iff : forall n m p : nat, Nat.max n m < p < -> n < p /\ m < p
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
app_assoc : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), l ++ m ++ n = (l ++ m) ++ n
skipn_firstn_comm : forall (A : Type) (m n : nat) (l : list A), skipn m (firstn n l) = firstn (n - m) (skipn m l)
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}
Forall2_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (x : X) (l : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: m) < -> R x y /\ Forall2 R l m
Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) m -> {m1 : list Y & {m2 : list Y | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ m = m1 ++ m2}}
Permutation_length_2_inv : forall (A : Type) (a1 a2 : A) (l : list A), a1 :: a2 :: nil ~p l -> l = a1 :: a2 :: nil \/ l = a2 :: a1 :: nil
exists_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (l : list B), (exists k : A, Forall (P k) l) -> Forall (fun x : B => exists k : A, P k x) l
Forall_image : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list B), Forall (fun y : B => exists x : A, y = f x) l < -> (exists l' : list A, l = map f l')
Permutation_length_2 : forall (A : Type) (a1 a2 b1 b2 : A), a1 :: a2 :: nil ~p b1 :: b2 :: nil -> a1 = b1 /\ a2 = b2 \/ a1 = b2 /\ a2 = b1
Forall_impl : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), (forall x : X, In x ll -> P x -> Q x) -> Forall P ll -> Forall Q ll
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, In x l -> P x)
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y) | Lt_tl : forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Ltl A leA x y -> Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Permutation_vs_cons_cons_inv : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (a b : A), l ~p a :: b :: l' -> exists l1 l2 l3 : list A, l = l1 ++ a :: l2 ++ b :: l3 \/ l = l1 ++ b :: l2 ++ a :: l3
neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ Forall P l -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
Permutation_cons_append : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (x : A), x :: l ~p l ++ x :: nil
Lt_hd : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A), leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y)
Inductive Permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_nil : nil ~p nil | perm_skip : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l' | perm_swap : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l | perm_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> l' ~p l'' -> l ~p l'' Arguments Permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments perm_nil _%type_scope Arguments perm_skip [A]%type_scope _ [l l']%list_scope Arguments perm_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments perm_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Desc A leA l -> P l
Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Desc A leA l -> P l
concat_nil_Forall : forall (A : Type) (l : list (list A)), concat l = nil < -> Forall (fun x : list A => x = nil) l
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
Forall_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) (ll : list X), Forall P (x :: ll) < -> P x /\ Forall P ll
Lt_nil : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x : list A), Ltl A leA nil (a :: x)

```  
intros H.
inversion H.
left.
exists (a :: x).
auto.
